text: William Tripp Woolsey (September 13, 1934 â€“ June 25, 2022) was an American competition swimmer. He represented the United States at the 1952 Summer Olympics in Helsinki, Finland, where he won a gold medal. Four years later at the 1956 Summer Olympics in Melbourne, Australia, he won a silver medal. Woolsey was born in Honolulu, Hawaii. Woolsey died on June 25, 2022 in California at the age of 87. ==References== Category:1934 births Category:2022 deaths Category:American swimmers Category:Olympic gold medalists for the United States Category:Olympic silver medalists for the United States Category:Sportspeople from Hawaii Category:People from Honolulu
title: Bill Woolsey
